intro: Genista acutiflora, commonly known as the sharp-flowered broom, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Its shrub-like growth habit makes it a hardy and resilient plant in Mediterranean climates.
